help.title: Response Screening
help.body:
Description
Performs an automated response screening to identify statistically significant predictors for one or more response variables.
It systematically fits models using all possible combinations of predictors (up to a user-specified limit - default is 1) to analyze main effect and reports key statistics such as p-values, -log10(p-value), adjusted p-value with FDR, -log10(FDR), effect sizes, and R² values.

Note on FDR:
When performing many hypothesis tests (as in response screening across multiple predictors), some significant p-values can occur by chance.
The False Discovery Rate (FDR) adjustment helps control this by estimating the expected proportion of false positives among all significant results.
The function uses the Benjamini–Hochberg procedure (p.adjust(..., method = "fdr")) to compute FDR-adjusted p-values, shown as FDR_pval.
FDR_pval gives a more conservative significance estimate that accounts for multiple comparisons.
Log_FDR_pval = -log10(FDR_pval) transforms the adjusted p-value to the same scale as LogWorth i.e. -log10(p-value), making it easy to rank predictors even after correction.

Automatic model generation:
Tests every possible combination of predictor variables up to a chosen maximum number (max_predictors).
For example, set max_predictors = 1 to test only single predictors, 2 for pairs, etc.

Flexible response handling:
Continuous responses → Linear regression (lm())
Binary categorical responses → Logistic regression (glm(family = binomial))

Effect size calculatiob formulas:
Continuous Y: Square root of the average sum of squares from the hypothesis test divided by a robust estimate of response SD (using IQR/1.3489795 if IQR > range/20, else sample SD).
Categorical Y, continuous X: Square root of the average model ChiSquare value.
Categorical Y, categorical X: Square root of the average Pearson ChiSquare value.

Multiple testing correction:
Adjusts all p-values using the False Discovery Rate (FDR) method, adding FDR_PValue and FDR_Logworth columns.

LogWorth metric: Reports -log10(p-value) and -log10(FDR-adjusted p-value) for ranking significance (larger = more significant).

Automatic case filtering: Skips any response with fewer than min_cases (default is 2) valid observations.
